title: How to Make Blueberry Vinegar

steps.headline: Place the blueberries and vinegar in the jar.
steps.description: (If using a glass canning jar, place plastic wrap over the mouth of the jar and then the metal lid and screw on metal top. This prevents any risk of the vinegar contacting with metal.)

steps.headline: Shake the jar and put to one side to steep.
steps.description: Continue to shake the jar once a day for 3 days.

steps.headline: Pour into a suitable bottle for storage.
steps.description: The vinegar can be used in a variety of dishes that require vinegar, such as salad dressings, marinades and in herbal remedies.

text: Place the blueberries and vinegar in the jar. (If using a glass canning jar, place plastic wrap over the mouth of the jar and then the metal lid and screw on metal top. This prevents any risk of the vinegar contacting with metal.) Shake the jar and put to one side to steep. Continue to shake the jar once a day for 3 days. Strain the vinegar after 3 days.  Pour into a suitable bottle for storage. The vinegar can be used in a variety of dishes that require vinegar, such as salad dressings, marinades and in herbal remedies. Finished.
